Authors: Perbangsa A.S., Febdro, Wijaya W., Amelia A., Pardamean B.
Title: Model of web-based supply chain management system for salt industry
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Perbangsa, A.S., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Febdro, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wijaya, W., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Amelia, A., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Pardamean, B., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The salt industry finds it difficult to meet the high demand because of the difficulty to predict and meet the needs of raw materials, and also to allocate products. Supply Chain Management (SCM) system can overcome these problems, but the existing SCM is not yet in accordance with business processes for the salt industry. This research intended to create a model of web-based supply chain management (e-SCM) for Salt Industry. The data were gathered through interviews, questionnaires, and literature review. The analysis and design of the system used the Object Oriented Analysis & Design (OOAD) method which refers to Unified Process and using Unified Modeling Language (UML) notation. The analysis method is applied while the business is being operated and is based on the needs of the industry. The result of this research was an e-SCM system model that is intended to support operational activities for salt industry. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: model; salt industry; supply chain management system; web-based
Index Keywords: Information management; Models; Surveys; Unified Modeling Language; Websites; Analysis method; Business Process; Literature reviews; Object-oriented analysis; Operational activity; Salt industry; Supply chain management system; Web based; Supply chain management
